archetype_name: Family Low-Sodium American & French Comfort (30–60, Mild)
name: Lentil & Mushroom Cottage Pie with Buttered Peas
description: A hearty, low-sodium lentil and mushroom filling topped with creamy mashed potatoes and served with simple buttered peas. Comforting American–French bistro style made from scratch in under an hour.
prep_steps: Rinse 1 cup lentils under cool water; drain.
Dice 1 onion and 2 carrots; finely chop 2 celery stalks.
Peel and cut 2 lb potatoes into 1-inch chunks.
Chop a small handful of parsley (for garnish).
Measure 2 cups vegetable stock and 2 tbsp tomato paste.
cook_steps: Add potatoes to a pot, cover with water, bring to a boil, and cook until tender, 12–15 minutes.
While potatoes cook, heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat; sauté mushrooms until they release liquid and brown, 5–6 minutes.
Add onion, carrots, and celery to the skillet with another 1 tbsp olive oil if needed; cook until softened, 5–6 minutes.
Stir in garlic, 1 tsp thyme, 1 bay leaf, and 1/2 tsp black pepper; cook 30 seconds.
Add lentils, vegetable stock, and tomato paste; stir, bring to a simmer, then reduce heat and cook until lentils are tender and the mixture is saucy, 18–22 minutes. Remove bay leaf.
Drain potatoes well; mash with 3 tbsp butter and 1/3–1/2 cup milk to a smooth, spreadable consistency. Season with black pepper to taste.
Spread the mashed potatoes over the lentil-mushroom mixture in the skillet (or transfer filling to a baking dish first). Use a spoon to rough up the top.
Bake until the topping lightly browns and the filling bubbles at the edges, 12–15 minutes. Rest 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, steam 2 cups peas until tender, 3–4 minutes. Toss with 1 tbsp butter and a pinch of black pepper.
Serve wedges of cottage pie with buttered peas. Garnish with chopped parsley.
